sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Find the derivative of f(x)=-3x^7 using the power rule.
message_2:
To find the derivative of f(x) = -3x^7 using the power rule, we apply the rule: (d/dx)(x^n) = nx^(n-1), where n is the exponent.

In this case, n = 7. So, the derivative f'(x) will be:

f'(x) = 7 * (-3x^7)^(7-1)
f'(x) = 7 * (-3x^6)
f'(x) = -21x^6
